intro: Gymnopetalum scabrum var. pectinatum, commonly known as the roughleaf pectinatum, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded, forested environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
